definition: to try to find/to look for/to call on sb/to find/to seek/to return/to give change
to touch/to come in contact with/to feel/to be affected by/to catch fire/to burn/(coll.) to fall asleep/(after a verb) hitting the mark/succeeding in
aspect particle indicating action in progress

sentences.english: It goes without saying , no one here in our place has seen the new book.
sentences.chinese: 没有见到新教材就参加培训，有时会有点找不着北。

sentences.english: At first listen, seem to have very reasonable, everyone will find north.
sentences.chinese: 乍一听，似乎都很有道理，大家就找不着北了。

sentences.english: It's a colloquialism in north China.
sentences.chinese: 这找不着北啊是口语里的一种说法。

sentences.english: We need a new strategy that will make our enemies scratch their heads.
sentences.chinese: 我门需要一个让我门的敌人找不着北的策略。

sentences.english: Quite many painters, once getting involved in the market, would get lost.
sentences.chinese: 不少画家一旦介入市场自己就找不着北。

definition: to be in a sorry state/to be utterly defeated
amidst the clouds and mist/(fig.) mystified/puzzled
to suffer a crushing defeat (idiom)/in a pitiful state/in a complete mess/to roll (with laughter)
to piss in one's pants in terror (idiom); scared witless
to get carried away/to forget oneself
to cover one's head and sneak away like a rat (idiom); to flee ignominiously
